active_alerts.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 26 at 3:53AM EST until January 26 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
active_alerts.description:
* WHAT...Surfaces remain slick and hazardous from Sunday's wintry
mix. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph over the mountains.

* WHERE...Portions of northeast Georgia, Piedmont and western North
Carolina, and Upstate South Carolina.

* WHEN...Until 1 PM EST this afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Although precipitation has ended for much of the area,
many roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will remain
slick and hazardous this morning.
active_alerts.instruction:
Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while
driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken
on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and
slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

If you need shelter, sheltering information and other human services
in your area can be found by dialing 211.

active_alerts.headline: Cold Weather Advisory issued January 26 at 2:29AM EST until January 27 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
active_alerts.description:
* WHAT...Very cold wind chills as low as 4 above expected.

* WHERE...The foothills and Piedmont of northeast Georgia, western
North Carolina, and Upstate South Carolina.

* WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to noon EST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...The cold wind chills as low as 5 above zero could result
in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
active_alerts.instruction:
Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

Make frequent checks on older family, friends, and neighbors. Ensure
portable heaters are used correctly. Do not use generators or grills
inside.
